intro: Alona sphaerophylla, commonly known as the globeflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive globular inflorescence, which consists of numerous small, white or pink flowers clustered together. The plant is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high altitudes. Alona sphaerophylla is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
